title: [BUG] mlflow ui and server 404
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: OS X
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.4.0
- **Python version**: 3.7.3
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**: mlflow ui

### Describe the problem
Sometimes when I start mlflow ui or server, I get a 404 from my localhost:5000 just going to the main page.  Using the default file store, no parameters.  I'm trying to figure out the the exact steps to reproduce but it happens pretty often.  I think deleting ./mlruns fixes it temporarily.  

I have a related issue that I'll file in another bug that may point to the model registry as a source of the issue.

### Code to reproduce issue
```
cd example/sklearn_elasticnet_wine
mlflow run .
mlflow ui
```


### Other info / logs
```
(base) ➜  mlflow git:(prophet-example) ✗ mlflow ui
/usr/local/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/jinja2/utils.py:485: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
  from collections import MutableMapping
/usr/local/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/jinja2/runtime.py:318: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
  from collections import Mapping
[2019-11-05 11:19:49 -0500] [36160] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 19.9.0
[2019-11-05 11:19:49 -0500] [36160] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:5000 (36160)
[2019-11-05 11:19:49 -0500] [36160] [INFO] Using worker: sync
[2019-11-05 11:19:49 -0500] [36163] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 36163
/usr/local/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/jinja2/utils.py:485: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
  from collections import MutableMapping
/usr/local/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/jinja2/runtime.py:318: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will stop working
  from collections import Mapping
^C[2019-11-05 11:20:11 -0500] [36160] [INFO] Handling signal: int
[2019-11-05 11:20:11 -0500] [36163] [INFO] Worker exiting (pid: 36163)

Aborted!
```
